bestBHT.bht: A group of more than forty individuals formed a conspiracy, swearing together and planning against Paul's life. Their intention was to carry out their design and take Paul out of the hands of the soldiers. This oath-bound agreement posed a serious threat to Paul's safety, as such a large number of desperate men were determined to see their plan through.

Albert Barnes: This large number of desperate men, bound by so solemn an oath, would be likely to be successful, and the life of Paul was therefore in special danger.
The manner in which they purposed to accomplish their design is stated in Acts 23:15.
Marvin Vincent: Conspiracy [συνωμοσιαν] . Lit., swearing together; conjuration. According to its etymology, conspiracy is a breathing or blowing together (Latin, conspirare). Hence, of concerted thought and action.
Archibald T. Robertson: More than forty (πλειους τεσσερακοντα). Without 'than' (η) as in verse Acts 23:21; Acts 24:11 and often in the ancient Greek.
Conspiracy (συνωμοσιαν). Old word from συνομνυμ, to swear together. Only here in the N.T.
John Gill: the word rendered 'conspiracy', signifies an agreement by oath
such a number of them banded together
they might have strength sufficient to take Paul out of the hands of the soldiers

bhtAttempts.bht: A group of more than forty individuals formed a conspiracy, swearing together and planning against Paul's life. Their intention was to carry out their design and take Paul out of the hands of the soldiers. This oath-bound agreement posed a serious threat to Paul's safety, as such a large number of desperate men were determined to see their plan through.

A conspiracy, characterized by a breathing or blowing together, was formed by a group of more than forty individuals who swore together. This agreement, established through an oath, presented a significant danger to Paul's life as they planned to overpower the soldiers and seize him. Their sheer numbers and resolute determination made them a formidable force, posing a real threat to Paul's safety.

A conspiracy, deriving from the word meaning an agreement by oath, was orchestrated by a group of more than forty individuals who joined together in a solemn bond. Their goal was to forcefully take Paul out of the hands of the soldiers, which posed a considerable threat to his life. With their concerted thought and action, this large number of desperate men posed a significant danger to Paul's safety, as they were determined to carry out their plan.

More than forty individuals formed a conspiracy, swearing together and planning against Paul's life. This oath-bound agreement posed a serious threat to Paul's safety, as such a large number of desperate men were determined to see their plan through. Their concerted thought and action, along with their resolute determination, made them a formidable force, putting Paul in great danger. They intended to overpower the soldiers and seize Paul, with the strength of their numbers working to their advantage.

More than forty individuals conspired against Paul, swearing together and planning his demise. This conspiracy, rooted in their concerted thought and action, posed a grave threat to Paul's life. By banding together with a solemn oath, these desperate men aimed to overpower the soldiers and take Paul from their grasp. Their determination, coupled with their sheer numbers, made them a formidable force, endangering Paul's safety and intensifying the urgency of the situation.
